str2: Three times. Adverb from treis; three times.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To beat with rods, scourge. From rhabdos; to strike with a stick, i.e. Bastinado.
Once, once for all. Probably from hapas; one time.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To stone, pelt with stones. From lithos; to lapidate.
Three times. Adverb from treis; three times.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From a compound of naus and ago; to be shipwrecked, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
A night and day, twenty-four hours. From nux and hemera; a day-and-night, i.e. Full day of twenty-four hours.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The deep sea, the bottom. A variation of bathos; depth, i.e. the sea.
